    Podcast for research

    Podcasting for research and science outreach programmes

    Peter Schmidt

    Podcaster, Researcher, Software Engineer, SSI Fellow

    • London, UK
    • Email
    • Code for Thought
    • YouTube
    • Patreon
    • LinkedIn
    • Mastodon
    • Twitter/X
    • GitHub
    • Orcid

    Podcasts are a great way to bring your important research work to the attention of a wider public. Sadly, we live in times, where research work is at times undervalued, rejected or simply ignored (see discussions around climate change and vaccines). And I believe that explaining what we do and why has become more important than ever.

    Of course, there are popular science podcasts out there. However, with such a huge reseach output every year, the big stations can only skim the surface and tend to focus on widely known and popular researchers and research programs.

    At the same time, I think it is important to give all researchers an opportunity to share their work with the wider public.

    With that in mind, I am thrilled to work with the linguistics team at the Humboldt-Universit√§t in Berlin, Germany, since June 2023. The team have a list of exciting research on a wide range of themes around the use and effect of language in our daily lives. Together, we started a podcast (in German) called Register Geknister, which is available on all major podcast directories since August 2023.

    If you like the idea of sharing your work using podcasts, please, do get in touch via email.

    Updated: August 11, 2023
